is a quiet coastal town on the
. It is on the mouth of the Tillamook Bay and an excellent hub of crabbing, fishing, clamming and several other sea activities.
To get to Garibaldi take highway 101 from the North or South or highway 6 from the East. Located 75 miles West of Portland and 8 miles North of Tillamook.

is a local business at the marina that rents equipment for many activities.
You have to visit the Bayfront Bakery as they boast some of the best baked goods on the coast.
Try a fish fry and buy some seafood at Miller's Seafood Market or Bay Ocean Seafood or Louise's Crab Co.

directions=.2 mi South of 101 on Port of Garibaldi

content=We are a locally-owned and -operated motel and RV park right out on the Port of Garibaldi, Oregon. We are 50 yards from the boat launch and marina. If we were any closer, you'd be wet! Perfect for fishermen and families, we offer boat & trailer parking along with special rates for guests of our charter partners. 
Our 16 newly remodeled rooms with rates starting at $49/night are cheery and charming, featuring 1 or 2 queen beds, refrigerators, microwaves, coffee makers, flat screen TV with free cable & wi-fi. You can walk to restaurants, museums, antique shops, bakery, grocery stores and even ride the historic steam train. 
Our 30 space RV park features hot shower, 20, 30, 50 amp electric, water, sewer, cable TV and wi-fi all included in the rates, which start at just $27.50/night. 
We are right on Tillamook Bay with 3 major bays and 7 major rivers. You can launch your boat from here, go clamming & crabbing, and we're within easy driving distance of the towns of Tillamook, Bay City, Rockaway Beach, Manzanita, Wheeler, and Nehalem.

Take Highway 101 North or South or Highway 6 West towards Portland.
